summary: The Housing Acquisitions Review and Transparency Act (HART Act) modifies premerger notification requirements under the Clayton Act concerning acquisitions of residential property. It defines residential property, investment rental property, and short-term lodging. The bill treats all residential property acquisitions by a person within a year as a single acquisition for notification purposes, amends exemptions, and mandates rule changes by the Federal Trade Commission to enforce these changes and require relevant information to assess potential antitrust violations.
